ground_truth: Then suddenly, Fezzik, as he jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone his size, reaches for the Man In Black, who drops to his knees, spins loose, and slips between the Giant's legs. Fezzik considers this a moment, then attacks, and if he moved quickly last time, this time he is blinding, and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge, Fezzik moves right with him. Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet, this time the Man In Black jumps for Fezzik's back, and in a moment he is riding him, with his arms locked across Fezzik's windpipe, one in front, one behind. The Man In Black begins to squeeze, tighter. Fezzik charges toward a huge rock that lines the path, and just as he reaches it, he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black. The power of the charge is terrible, the pain enormous, but he clings to his grip on Fezzik's windpipe. Again Fezzik charges, slower this time, but still a charge, and again he spins and creams the Man In Black against the rough boulder. The punishment is terrible, and for a moment, it seems as if he is going to let go of Fezzik's windpipe and crumble, but he doesn't; he holds on. Again Fezzik slams the Man In Black against a boulder, only this time his power has diminished, and Fezzik starts to slowly collapse. There isn't much breath coming. The Man In Black, holding his grip as Fezzik tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no air. Back to his knees he falls, holds there for a moment, and pitches down to all fours. The Man In Black increases the pressure. Fezzik tries to crawl, but there is just no air. Fezzik goes to earth and lies still. Fezzik, as the Man In Black turns him over, puts his ear to Fezzik's heart. The Man In Black stands and nimbly scoops up his sword with his foot, catches it as he dashes off up along the mountain path. Prince Humperdinck slips his boot into a footprint in the sand. Count Rugen, mounted, watches. Behind him, half a dozen armed warriors, also mounted. A great white horse waits riderless in front. Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground, and maybe he isn't the best hunter in the world. Then again, maybe he is, because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions, we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers. And he gallops off. The Man In Black is cresting the peak of the mountain.

Fezzik lunges toward a massive rock that borders the path, and just as he reaches it, he spins his enormous body so that the entire heft of the charge is endured by the Man In Black. This is considered a moment by Fezzik, then he attacks, and if he moved quickly last time, this time he is blinding, and as the charge is avoided by the Man In Black slipping down, the movement is made right with him by Fezzik. The pressure is increased by the Man In Black. An attempt to crawl is made by Fezzik, but there is just no air. The earth is gone to by Fezzik, and still he lies. Fezzik is turned over by the Man In Black, who puts his ear to Fezzik's heart. His sword is scooped up nimbly by the Man In Black as he stands, catching it with his foot as he dashes off up along the mountain path. A footprint in the sand is slipped into by Prince Humperdinck with his boot. Count Rugen, mounted, watches. Behind him, also mounted, are half a dozen armed warriors. Then again, maybe he is, because as strange positions are begun to be put into by him with his feet, we realize that what is being done by him is miming the fencers. And he gallops off. The peak of the mountain is crested by the Man In Black.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Fezzik, with astonishing speed for his size, lunges at the Man In Black, who drops to his knees, spins, and slips between Fezzik's legs. Fezzik quickly attacks again, but this time, the Man In Black leaps onto his back, locking his arms across Fezzik's windpipe. As Fezzik charges a massive rock, he spins, slamming the Man In Black against it. Despite the terrible impact, he retains his grip. Fezzik charges slower but repeats the maneuver, grinding him against the boulder. The punishment wears on the Man In Black, but he holds on. Fezzik, weakened, collapses as air runs out. The Man In Black increases pressure; Fezzik attempts to crawl but succumbs. The Man In Black checks Fezzik's heart, then grabs his sword as he dashes up the mountain path. Prince Humperdinck examines a footprint in the sand while Count Rugen and mounted warriors watch, a riderless white horse nearby. Humperdinck mimics fencing stances and rides off. The Man In Black reaches the mountain's peak.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Fezzik lunges for the Man In Black, who drops to his knees, spins free, and slips between Fezzik's legs. Fezzik attacks again, moving with blinding speed, and as the Man In Black avoids the charge, he jumps onto Fezzik's back, locking his arms around Fezzik's windpipe. Fezzik charges into a rock, the impact terrible, but the Man In Black holds on. Fezzik charges again, slamming the Man In Black against a boulder, but the Man In Black maintains his grip. Fezzik's strength fades, and he collapses, unable to breathe. The Man In Black listens to Fezzik's heart, then retrieves his sword and continues up the mountain path. Prince Humperdinck places his boot in a footprint, watched by Count Rugen and armed warriors. Humperdinck, miming fencers, gallops off. The Man In Black reaches the mountain peak.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Then, all of a sudden, Fezzik, with a surprising burst of momentum and stunning agility for someone of his imposing size, lunges toward the Man In Black. The Man In Black swiftly drops to his knees, executing a fluid spin to evade capture, and gracefully slips between the Giant's massive legs. Fezzik pauses momentarily, contemplating his next move, before initiating another attack; if his last maneuver was quick, this time his movements are absolutely blinding in their speed. As the Man In Black ducks down to evade the oncoming charge, Fezzik skillfully mirrors his movement, keeping pace with him. Rather than twisting away and leaping to his feet as before, this time the Man In Black strategically leaps onto Fezzik's back, securing a firm grip with his arms locked tightly around Fezzik's windpipe, one arm positioned in front and the other behind. He begins to increase the pressure, tightening his hold.

Fezzik charges forward with great force toward a hefty rock lining the narrow path, and just as he reaches it, he spins his enormous body around so that the full weight and momentum of his charge are absorbed by the Man In Black. The force of the impact is immense, the pain excruciating, yet despite this, the Man In Black resolutely maintains his grip on Fezzik's windpipe. Fezzik charges once more, moving somewhat slower this time, but still executing a powerful charge, and once again he spins and crashes the Man In Black against the unforgiving roughness of the boulder. The punishment inflicted is severe, and for a fleeting moment, it seems as if he might relinquish his grip and collapse. However, he perseveres, clutching firmly. Fezzik slams him against yet another boulder, but this time his strength has waned, and he begins to sink slowly under the strain. Breathing becomes increasingly difficult.

The Man In Black holds firm as Fezzik struggles to regain his footing, managing to rise partway, yet no air comes. He sinks back to his knees, pausing briefly before toppling onto all fours. With renewed determination, the Man In Black tightens his grip. Fezzik attempts to crawl forward, but there is simply no air left for him. Fezzik collapses to the ground, motionless. As the Man In Black rolls Fezzik over, he listens intently to Fezzik's heart, ensuring all is still. Then he stands, deftly retrieves his sword by flipping it into the air with his foot, catching it skillfully as he races up along the mountain path.

Meanwhile, Prince Humperdinck carefully places his boot into a footprint left in the sand. Count Rugen, astride a horse, observes the scene. Behind him, half a dozen armed warriors, also mounted, await orders. A magnificent white horse stands riderless in front. Humperdinck is scattered across the rocky terrain, and while he may not appear to be the world's greatest hunter, perhaps he is, because as he mimics the elegant movements of the fencers, we recognize his purpose. With determination, he rides off. Meanwhile, the Man In Black reaches the peak, cresting the mountain with urgency.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Then, in an unexpected turn of events, Fezzik, with a surprising burst of momentum and an astonishing display of agility for someone of such significant and imposing size, suddenly lunges forcefully toward the Man In Black. The Man In Black swiftly, almost instinctively, drops down to his knees, executing a fluid and seamless spin to effectively evade capture, and gracefully slips nimbly between the Giant's massive and towering legs. Fezzik pauses momentarily, contemplating deeply his next strategic move, before initiating yet another forceful attack; if his previous maneuver had been quick, this time, his movements are absolutely blinding in their incredible speed and precision. As the Man In Black adeptly ducks down to evade the oncoming charge, Fezzik effortlessly mirrors his movement, managing to keep pace with him. Rather than twisting away and springing to his feet as he did before, this time the Man In Black strategically leaps onto Fezzik's back, securing a firm grip with his arms locked tightly around Fezzik's windpipe, one arm positioned securely in front and the other behind. He begins to increase the pressure, gradually tightening his hold.

Fezzik charges forward with great force and determination toward a hefty rock lining the narrow path, and just as he reaches it, he spins his enormous body around so that the full weight and momentum of his powerful charge are absorbed entirely by the Man In Black. The force of the impact is immense, the pain excruciating, yet, despite this, the Man In Black resolutely maintains his unyielding grip on Fezzik's windpipe. Fezzik charges once more, this time moving somewhat slower, yet still executing a powerful charge, and once again he spins and crashes the Man In Black against the unforgiving roughness of the boulder. The punishment inflicted is severe, and for a fleeting moment, it seems as if he might relinquish his grip and collapse. However, he perseveres, clutching firmly. Fezzik slams him against yet another boulder, but this time his strength has waned considerably, and he begins to sink slowly under the strain. Breathing becomes increasingly difficult.

The Man In Black, holding firm, watches as Fezzik struggles to regain his footing, managing to rise partway, yet no air comes. He sinks back to his knees, pausing briefly before toppling onto all fours. With renewed determination and focus, the Man In Black tightens his grip further. Fezzik attempts to crawl forward with effort, but there is simply no air left for him. Fezzik collapses to the ground, motionless. As the Man In Black rolls Fezzik over, he listens intently to Fezzik's heart, ensuring that all is still. Then he stands, deftly retrieves his sword by skillfully flipping it into the air with his foot, catching it with precision as he races swiftly up along the mountain path with urgency.

Meanwhile, Prince Humperdinck carefully places his boot into a distinct footprint left in the sand. Count Rugen, sitting astride a horse, observes the scene keenly. Behind him, half a dozen armed warriors, also mounted, await his orders attentively. A magnificent white horse stands riderless in front, exuding a sense of elegance. Humperdinck is scattered across the rocky terrain, and while he may not appear to be the world's greatest hunter, perhaps he truly is, because as he mimics the elegant and precise movements of the fencers, we recognize his determined purpose. With resolution, he rides off confidently. Meanwhile, the Man In Black reaches the peak, cresting the mountain with a sense of urgency and determination.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Then, with a sudden burst of energy, Fezzik, displaying a stunning speed that seems improbable for his size, leaps forward with determination, reaching out aggressively toward the Man In Black. But the Man In Black is swift and reactive, instantly dropping to his knees to avoid Fezzik's grasp. He expertly spins loose from the imminent danger and smoothly slips between the giant's towering legs, evading capture. Fezzik takes a brief moment of contemplation before launching another attack. If his previous movement was quick, this time it is blindingly fast as he charges again. As the Man In Black ducks low to avoid the oncoming force, Fezzik mirrors his movements, staying right on target. The Man In Black, instead of attempting to twist free and regain his footing on the ground, makes a bold move by leaping onto Fezzik's back. Within seconds, he positions himself securely, clinging tightly with his arms locked around Fezzik's windpipe, securing one arm in front and the other behind. The Man In Black then starts to exert pressure, squeezing tighter in an attempt to subdue the giant. In response, Fezzik charges toward a massive rock lining the path, intending to use it as a tool to dislodge his opponent. As he nears the obstacle, he spins his colossal body with considerable force, aiming for the charge to be absorbed by the Man In Black. Despite the crushing impact and the tremendous pain it causes, the Man In Black tenaciously maintains his grip on Fezzik’s windpipe. Fezzik gives it another attempt, charging once more albeit at a slower pace, and spins again to slam the Man In Black against the rough surface of the boulder. The repeated blows are excruciating, and for a fleeting moment, it seems the Man In Black might relinquish his hold on Fezzik's windpipe and collapse from the strain. Nevertheless, he perseveres, holding firm. Fezzik repeats the maneuver, crashing the Man In Black into the rock once more, though his power is noticeably waning, and he begins to falter, his strength depleting as his breath becomes scarce. Desperately trying to maintain balance, Fezzik half-heartedly attempts to stand, managing only to bring himself to his knees before succumbing and falling forward onto all fours. Sensing the opportunity, the Man In Black intensifies the pressure. Fezzik struggles to crawl, yet finds himself unable to breathe, his efforts futile. Ultimately, Fezzik collapses to the ground, lying motionless. The Man In Black carefully turns him over, placing an attentive ear to Fezzik's chest to check his heartbeat. Satisfied, he stands up and, with a display of agility, deftly scoops his sword up with his foot, catching it in his hand as he swiftly dashes off up along the mountain path. Meanwhile, Prince Humperdinck moves with calculated precision, slipping his boot into a distinct footprint in the sand. Count Rugen, seated on his horse, observes the scene calmly, flanked by half a dozen armed warriors also mounted on horses, with a majestic white horse standing riderless ahead. Despite Humperdinck's movements over the rocky terrain suggesting incompetence, he reveals his prowess as he begins to mimic the motions of fencers, indicating his skill as a hunter is indeed remarkable. Confidently, he gallops off in pursuit. Atop the landscape, the Man In Black is seen cresting the peak of the mountain, forging ahead.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Fezzik, with surprising agility for his size, lunges at the Man In Black, who swiftly drops to his knees and evades by slipping between Fezzik's legs. As Fezzik launches another blinding attack, the Man In Black jumps onto his back, securing a chokehold around Fezzik's windpipe. Fezzik charges toward a boulder, spinning to slam the Man In Black against it, but the Man In Black maintains his grip despite the pain. Fezzik attempts this maneuver again with diminishing strength, ultimately collapsing as his breath runs out while the Man In Black's hold tightens. Fezzik tries to crawl but succumbs to the lack of air and falls still. The Man In Black checks Fezzik's heartbeat, retrieves his sword with a deft move, and quickly proceeds up the mountain path. Meanwhile, Prince Humperdinck, accompanied by Count Rugen and several mounted warriors, examines a footprint in the sand. Displaying his hunting prowess, Humperdinck mimics the fencers' movements and gallops off. The Man In Black reaches the mountain peak.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, Fezzik, renowned among the inhabitants of the fictional realm of Florin for his incredible size and strength, as he jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone his size, reaches for the Man In Black, a mysterious figure known for his exceptional agility and combat skills, who drops to his knees, spins loose, and slips between the Giant's legs. Fezzik, who once participated in professional wrestling matches to make a living, considers this a moment, then attacks, and if he moved quickly last time, this time he is blinding, and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge, Fezzik moves right with him. Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet, this time the Man In Black jumps for Fezzik's back, and in a moment he is riding him, with his arms locked across Fezzik's windpipe, one in front, one behind. The Man In Black begins to squeeze, tighter. Fezzik, employing a tactic he learned during his wrestling days, charges toward a huge rock that lines the path, a large stone known to the villagers as the Guardian Boulder, and just as he reaches it, he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black. The power of the charge is terrible, the pain enormous, but he clings to his grip on Fezzik's windpipe. Again Fezzik charges, slower this time, but still a charge, and again he spins and creams the Man In Black against the rough boulder. The punishment is terrible, and for a moment, it seems as if he is going to let go of Fezzik's windpipe and crumble, but he doesn't; he holds on. Again Fezzik slams the Man In Black against a boulder, only this time his power has diminished, and Fezzik starts to slowly collapse. There isn't much breath coming. The Man In Black, holding his grip as Fezzik tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no air. Back to his knees he falls, holds there for a moment, and pitches down to all fours. The Man In Black increases the pressure, his mind recalling the last time he executed a similar maneuver while training with a master grappler from a far-off land. Fezzik tries to crawl, but there is just no air. Fezzik goes to earth and lies still. Fezzik, as the Man In Black turns him over, puts his ear to Fezzik's heart, listening for the reassuring thud that signifies life. The Man In Black stands and nimbly scoops up his sword, an impressive weapon forged by the master blacksmiths of Guilder, with his foot, catches it as he dashes off up along the mountain path, a treacherous route known for its steep inclines and loose gravel. Prince Humperdinck, known throughout Florin as an avid hunter with a taste for theatrics, slips his boot into a footprint in the sand. Count Rugen, notorious for his interest in pain and the invention of deadly mechanisms, mounted, watches. Behind him, half a dozen armed warriors, also mounted. A great white horse, bred in the royal stables for its speed and stamina, waits riderless in front. Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground, and maybe he isn't the best hunter in the world. Then again, maybe he is, because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions, we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers known for their intricate footwork. And he gallops off. The Man In Black is cresting the peak of the mountain, a vantage point offering the first glimpse of the treacherous descent into the valley below.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. Then again maybe he is because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers. And he gallops off. The Man In Black is cresting the peak of the mountain.

Fezzik charges toward a huge rock that lines the path and just as he reaches it he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black. The power of the charge is terrible the pain enormous but he clings to his grip on Fezzik's windpipe. Again Fezzik charges slower this time but still a charge and again he spins and creams the Man In Black against the rough boulder. The punishment is terrible and for a moment it seems as if he is going to let go of Fezzik's windpipe and crumble but he does not. he holds on. Again Fezzik slams the Man In Black against a boulder. only this time his power has diminished and Fezzik starts to slowly collapse. There is not much breath coming. The Man In Black holding his grip as Fezzik tries to stand halfway makes it but there is no air. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Back to his knees he falls holds there for a moment and pitches down to all fours. The Man In Black increases the pressure. Fezzik tries to crawl but there is just no air. Fezzik goes to earth and lies still. Fezzik as the Man In Black turns him over puts his ear to Fezzik's heart. The Man In Black stands and nimbly scoops up his sword with his foot catches it as he dashes off up along the mountain path. Prince Humperdinck slips his boot into a footprint in the sand. Count Rugen mounted watches. Behind him half a dozen armed warriors also mounted. A great white horse waits riderless in front. Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground and maybe he is not the best hunter in the world. Then again maybe he is because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers. And he gallops off. The Man In Black is cresting the peak of the mountain.

Fezzik considers this a moment then attacks and if he moved quickly last time this time he is blinding and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge Fezzik moves right with him. Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet this time the Man In Black jumps for Fezzik's back and in a moment he is riding him with his arms locked across Fezzik's windpipe one in front one behind. The Man In Black begins to squeeze tighter. Fezzik charges toward a huge rock that lines the path and just as he reaches it he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black. Behind him half a dozen armed warriors also mounted. A great white horse waits riderless in front. Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground and maybe he is not the best hunter in the world. test_cases.description: Then suddenly Fezzik as he jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone his size reaches for the Man In Black who drops to his knees spins loose and slips between the Giant's legs. Fezzik considers this a moment then attacks and if he moved quickly last time this time he is blinding and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge Fezzik moves right with him. Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet this time the Man In Black jumps for Fezzik's back and in a moment he is riding him with his arms locked across Fezzik's windpipe one in front one behind. Then again maybe he is because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers. And he gallops off. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, the dragon, as it jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone its size, reaches for the soldier, who drops to his knees, spins loose, and slips between the fairy's legs. The dragon considers this a moment, then attacks, and if it moved quickly last time, this time it is blinding, and as the soldier slips down to avoid the charge, the dragon moves right with him. Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet, this time the soldier jumps for the dragon's back, and in a moment he is riding it, with his arms locked across the dragon's windpipe, one in front, one behind. The soldier begins to squeeze, tighter. The dragon charges toward a huge rock that lines the path, and just as it reaches it, it spins its giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the soldier. The power of the charge is terrible, the pain enormous, but he clings to his grip on the dragon's windpipe. Again the dragon charges, slower this time, but still a charge, and again it spins and creams the soldier against the rough boulder. The punishment is terrible, and for a moment, it seems as if he is going to let go of the dragon's windpipe and crumble, but he doesn't; he holds on. Again the dragon slams the soldier against a boulder, only this time its power has diminished, and it starts to slowly collapse. There isn't much breath coming. The soldier, holding his grip as the dragon tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no air. Back to its knees it falls, holds there for a moment, and pitches down to all fours. The soldier increases the pressure. The dragon tries to crawl, but there is just no air. The dragon goes to earth and lies still. The dragon, as the soldier turns it over, puts its ear to the dragon's heart. The soldier stands and nimbly scoops up his sword with his foot, catches it as he dashes off up along the mountain path. The owl slips its boot into a footprint in the sand. The fox, mounted, watches. Behind it, half a dozen armed elephants, also mounted. A great white horse waits riderless in front. The owl is all over the rocky ground, and maybe it isn't the best hunter in the world. Then again, maybe it is, because as it begins to put its feet into strange positions, we realize that what it is doing is miming the fencers. And it gallops off. The soldier is cresting the peak of the mountain.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, Fezzik, as he jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone his size, reaches for the Man In Black, who drops to his knees, spins loose, and slips between the Giant's legs. Fezzik considers this a moment, then attacks, and if he moved quickly last time, this time he is blinding, and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge, Fezzik moves right with him. Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet, this time the Man In Black jumps for Fezzik's back, and in a moment he is riding him, with his arms locked across Fezzik's windpipe, one in front, one behind. The Man In Black begins to squeeze, tighter. Fezzik charges toward a massive oak tree that lines the path, and just as he reaches it, he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black. The power of the charge is terrible, the pain enormous, but he clings to his grip on Fezzik's windpipe. Again Fezzik charges, slower this time, but still a charge, and again he spins and creams the Man In Black against the rough tree trunk. The punishment is terrible, and for a moment, it seems as if he is going to let go of Fezzik's windpipe and crumble, but he doesn't; he holds on. Again Fezzik slams the Man In Black against a tree trunk, only this time his power has diminished, and Fezzik starts to slowly collapse. There isn't much breath coming. The Man In Black, holding his grip as Fezzik tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no air. Back to his knees he falls, holds there for a moment, and pitches down to all fours. The Man In Black increases the pressure. Fezzik tries to crawl, but there is just no air. Fezzik goes to earth and lies still. Fezzik, as the Man In Black turns him over, puts his ear to Fezzik's chest. The Man In Black stands and nimbly scoops up his staff with his foot, catches it as he dashes off up along the forest trail. Prince Humperdinck slips his shoe into a footprint on the grass. Count Rugen, on horseback, watches. Behind him, half a dozen armed warriors, also on horseback. A great black stallion waits riderless in front. Humperdinck is all over the grassy field, and maybe he isn't the best hunter in the world. Then again, maybe he is, because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions, we realize that what he is doing is miming the archers. And he gallops off. The Man In Black is cresting the ridge of the forest.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, Fezzik, as he lunges forward with unexpected agility for anyone his size, gestures toward the Man In Black, who kneels, twirls free, and slides between the Giant's legs. Fezzik pauses for a moment, then lunges, and if he moved swiftly last time, this time he is blistering, and as the Man In Black crouches to dodge the rush, Fezzik maneuvers right with him. Instead of twirling loose and springing to his feet, this time the Man In Black climbs onto Fezzik's back, and in a moment he is perching on him, with his arms latched across Fezzik's shoulders, one above, one below. The Man In Black starts to press, tighter. Fezzik dashes toward a huge tree that lines the path, and just as he reaches it, he pivots his giant body so that the entire force of the dash is absorbed by the Man In Black. The impact of the dash is powerful, the discomfort immense, but he persists in his grip on Fezzik's shoulders. Again Fezzik dashes, slower this time, but still a dash, and again he pivots and grazes the Man In Black against the jagged boulder. The ordeal is severe, and for a moment, it seems as if he is about to release Fezzik's shoulders and collapse, but he doesn't; he maintains his hold. Again Fezzik pushes the Man In Black against a boulder, only this time his strength has lessened, and Fezzik starts to gradually falter. There isn't much air coming. The Man In Black, maintaining his grip as Fezzik attempts to rise, halfway gets up, but there is no air. Back to his knees he sinks, stays there for a moment, and lowers to all fours. The Man In Black applies more pressure. Fezzik tries to shuffle, but there is just no air. Fezzik goes to earth and lies motionless. Fezzik, as the Man In Black rotates him over, places his ear to Fezzik's chest. The Man In Black stands and deftly lifts his sword with his foot, catches it as he hurries off up along the mountain trail. Prince Humperdinck places his boot into a footprint in the sand. Count Rugen, seated, observes. Behind him, half a dozen armed warriors, also seated. A great white horse waits without a rider in front. Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground, and maybe he isn't the best tracker in the world. Then again, maybe he is, because as he begins to position his feet awkwardly, we realize that what he is doing is imitating the fencers. And he gallops away. The Man In Black is cresting the summit of the mountain.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, the bookshelf, as it jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone its size, reaches for the umbrella, who drops to its knees, spins loose, and slips between the piano's legs. The bookshelf considers this a moment, then attacks, and if it moved quickly last time, this time it is blinding, and as the umbrella slips down to avoid the charge, the bookshelf moves right with it. Instead of twisting free and jumping to its feet, this time the umbrella jumps for the bookshelf's back, and in a moment it is riding it, with its arms locked across the bookshelf's windpipe, one in front, one behind. The umbrella begins to squeeze, tighter. The bookshelf charges toward a huge cupcake that lines the path, and just as it reaches it, it spins its giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the umbrella. The power of the charge is terrible, the pain enormous, but it clings to its grip on the bookshelf's windpipe. Again the bookshelf charges, slower this time, but still a charge, and again it spins and creams the umbrella against the rough chandelier. The punishment is terrible, and for a moment, it seems as if it is going to let go of the bookshelf's windpipe and crumble, but it doesn't; it holds on. Again the bookshelf slams the umbrella against a chandelier, only this time its power has diminished, and the bookshelf starts to slowly collapse. There isn't much breath coming. The umbrella, holding its grip as the bookshelf tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no air. Back to its knees it falls, holds there for a moment, and pitches down to all fours. The umbrella increases the pressure. The bookshelf tries to crawl, but there is just no air. The bookshelf goes to earth and lies still. The bookshelf, as the umbrella turns it over, puts its ear to the bookshelf's heart. The umbrella stands and nimbly scoops up its stapler with its foot, catches it as it dashes off up along the highway path. The shoelace slips its boot into a footprint in the sand. The violin, mounted, watches. Behind it, half a dozen armed cucumbers, also mounted. A great white scooter waits riderless in front. The shoelace is all over the rocky ground, and maybe it isn't the best hunter in the world. Then again, maybe it is, because as it begins to put its feet into strange positions, we realize that what it is doing is miming the kettles. And it gallops off. The umbrella is cresting the peak of the highway.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, the rabbit, as it skips backward with surprising grace for anyone its size, lunges for the Sailor In Gray, who bows to his knees, rolls loose, and dances between the Mountain's legs. The rabbit ponders this a moment, then retreats, and if it shuffled swiftly last time, this time it is blinding, and as the Sailor In Gray slides down to avoid the retreat, the rabbit twirls right with it. Instead of flipping free and diving to its feet, this time the Sailor In Gray leaps for the rabbit's back, and in a moment it is clinging to it, with its arms looped across the rabbit's waist, one in front, one behind. The Sailor In Gray begins to hug, tighter. The rabbit sprints toward a giant tree that lines the path, and just as it reaches it, it pivots its giant body so that the entire weight of the sprint is taken by the Sailor In Gray. The force of the sprint is enormous, the discomfort immense, but it clings to its hold on the rabbit's waist. Again the rabbit sprints, slower this time, but still a sprint, and again it twirls and sandwiches the Sailor In Gray against the rough tree. The impact is severe, and for a moment, it seems as if the Sailor In Gray is going to release the rabbit's waist and stumble, but it doesn't; it holds on. Again the rabbit swings the Sailor In Gray against a tree, only this time its strength has waned, and the rabbit starts to slowly wilt. There isn't much strength coming. The Sailor In Gray, maintaining its hold as the rabbit tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no breath. Back to its knees it falls, holds there for a moment, and slumps down to all fours. The Sailor In Gray increases the hold. The rabbit tries to crawl, but there is just no breath. The rabbit goes to ground and lies still. The rabbit, as the Sailor In Gray flips it over, puts its nose to the rabbit's heart. The Sailor In Gray stands and swiftly flicks up its hat with its foot, catches it as it dances off down along the forest trail. King Rupert slides his shoe into an imprint in the dirt. Baron Acton, strolling, observes. Behind him, several unarmed guards, also lounging. A great black stallion waits riderless at the rear. Rupert is all over the muddy ground, and maybe he isn't the most observant tracker in the world. Then again, maybe he is, because as he begins to place his hands into strange positions, we realize that what he is doing is miming the dancers. And he marches off. The Sailor In Gray is nearing the base of the hill.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, Fezzik, as he glides backward with surprising elegance for anyone his size, lunges for the Man In Black, who vaults to his feet, twirls around, and squeezes through the Giant's arms. Fezzik ponders this a moment, then retreats, and if he moved swiftly before, this time he is sluggish, and as the Man In Black shuffles down to sidestep the approach, Fezzik drifts left with him. Instead of slipping free and sprinting away, this time the Man In Black leaps for Fezzik's shoulders, and in a moment he is perched on him, with his legs wrapped around Fezzik's torso, one above, one below. The Man In Black begins to tighten, harder. Fezzik trots toward a large bush that borders the path, and just as he arrives, he twists his enormous body so that the entire impact of the advance is absorbed by the Man In Black. The force of the advance is immense, the discomfort huge, but he holds tight to his clutch on Fezzik's torso. Again Fezzik trots, slower this time, but still a trot, and again he rotates and smashes the Man In Black against the jagged shrub. The impact is severe, and for a moment, it seems as if he is going to release Fezzik's torso and crumble, but he doesn't; he maintains his hold. Again Fezzik rubs the Man In Black against a shrub, only this time his energy has faded, and Fezzik starts to slowly kneel. There isn't much space left. The Man In Black, maintaining his clutch as Fezzik tries to rise, halfway achieves it, but there is no stability. Back to his feet he falls, holds there for a moment, and tumbles down to his back. The Man In Black tightens the grasp. Fezzik tries to roll, but there is just no stability. Fezzik goes to ground and lies motionless. Fezzik, as the Man In Black rolls him over, places his hand to Fezzik's forehead. The Man In Black stands and nimbly flicks up his hat with his hand, catches it as he skips off along the valley route. Prince Humperdinck places his glove into a shadow in the grass. Count Rugen, standing, observes. Behind him, half a dozen armored acrobats, also standing. A large black bear waits untethered nearby. Humperdinck is all over the sandy terrain, and maybe he isn't the most clumsy dancer in the world. Then again, maybe he is, because as he starts to place his hands into awkward positions, we realize that what he is doing is mimicking the acrobats. And he dances away. The Man In Black is descending the side of the valley.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Then suddenly, Tinkerbell, as she dances backward with surprising grace for anyone her age, reaches for the Wizard of Oz, who hops to his elbows, twirls loose, and shuffles under the Dolphin's belly. Tinkerbell analyzes this a moment, then frolics, and if she moved gently last time, this time she is dazzling, and as the Wizard of Oz shuffles up to dodge the leap, Tinkerbell shuffles left with him. Instead of twirling free and hopping to his hands, this time the Wizard of Oz hops for Tinkerbell's wings, and in a moment he is floating on her, with his legs tangled across Tinkerbell's antennae, one above, one below. The Wizard of Oz begins to tighten, closer. Tinkerbell prances toward a small pond that borders the river, and just as she reaches it, she rotates her tiny feet so that the entire force of the prance is absorbed by the Wizard of Oz. The strength of the prance is terrible, the discomfort gigantic, but he clings to his loop on Tinkerbell's antennae. Again Tinkerbell prances, slower this time, but still a prance, and again she rotates and pours the Wizard of Oz against the smooth pebble. The discomfort is terrible, and for a moment, it seems as if he is going to let go of Tinkerbell's antennae and tumble, but he doesn't; he holds on. Again Tinkerbell tangles the Wizard of Oz against a pebble, only this time her force has lessened, and Tinkerbell starts to gradually float. There isn't much giggle coming. The Wizard of Oz, maintaining his loop as Tinkerbell tries to hover, halfway accomplishes it, but there is no giggle. Back to his elbows he leaps, holds there for a moment, and tumbles down to two knees. The Wizard of Oz heightens the loop. Tinkerbell tries to flutter, but there is just no giggle. Tinkerbell drops to sea and swims still. Tinkerbell, as the Wizard of Oz turns her over, puts his eye to Tinkerbell's heart. The Wizard of Oz leaps and gracefully tosses up his wand with his knee, snatches it as he waltzes off down along the jungle stream. Captain Hook slips his slipper into a leaf in the mud. Sheriff of Nottingham, standing, listens. Beside him, half a dozen armored ghosts, also standing. A tiny red dragon waits riderless nearby. Hook is all around the sandy swamp, and maybe he isn't the best dancer in the galaxy. Then again, maybe he is, because as he starts to put his toes into unusual shapes, we realize that what he is doing is impersonating the jugglers. And he dashes away. The Wizard of Oz is diving the lake of the swamp.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Fezzik lunges at the Man in Black, who swiftly dodges between his legs. Fezzik attacks again with blinding speed, but the Man in Black jumps onto his back, locking his arms around Fezzik's windpipe. Fezzik charges toward a rock, slamming the Man in Black against it, yet he maintains his grip. Despite the punishment, the Man in Black holds on as Fezzik's strength wanes, eventually collapsing from lack of air. The Man in Black listens for Fezzik's heartbeat before retrieving his sword and continuing up the mountain. Prince Humperdinck, analyzing footprints, mimics the fencers' movements and rides off, with Count Rugen and armed warriors following. The Man in Black reaches the mountain peak.

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: The Man In Black increases the pressure Fezzik tries to crawl but there is just no air Fezzik goes to earth and lies still Fezzik as the Man In Black turns him over puts his ear to Fezzik's heart The Man In Black stands and nimbly scoops up his sword with his foot catches it as he dashes off up along the mountain path Prince Humperdinck slips his boot into a footprint in the sand Count Rugen mounted watches Behind him half a dozen armed warriors also mounted A great white horse waits riderless in front Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground and maybe he is not the best hunter in the world Then again maybe he is because as he begins to put his feet into strange positions we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers And he gallops off The Man In Black is cresting the peak of the mountain Then suddenly Fezzik as he jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone his size reaches for the Man In Black who drops to his knees spins loose and slips between the Giant's legs Fezzik considers this a moment then attacks and if he moved quickly last time this time he is blinding and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge Fezzik moves right with him Instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet this time the Man In Black jumps for Fezzik's back and in a moment he is riding him with his arms locked across Fezzik's windpipe one in front one behind The Man In Black begins to squeeze tighter Fezzik charges toward a huge rock that lines the path and just as he reaches it he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black The power of the charge is terrible the pain enormous but he clings to his grip on Fezzik's windpipe Again Fezzik charges slower this time but still a charge and again he spins and creams the Man In Black against the rough boulder The punishment is terrible and for a moment it seems as if he is going to let go of Fezzik's windpipe and crumble but he does not he holds on Again Fezzik slams the Man In Black against a boulder only this time his power has diminished and Fezzik starts to slowly collapse There is not much breath coming The Man In Black holding his grip as Fezzik tries to stand halfway makes it but there is no air Back to his knees he falls holds there for a moment and pitches down to all fours
